attributes.action: Remove all Standing Charges imposed by utility companies regardless saving £200+
attributes.additional_details:
In 2016 Ofgem removed requirements for Standing Charges(SC) recommended by the CMA An advantage to no SC -you only pay for energy you use. SC depends on supplier range from 5p to 60p/day- Electricity & 10p to 80p/day- Gas. 
Two examples below show huge differences in costs to consumers
British Gas
Electric 28pday= £102.54year  
Gas 35pday= £127.00year 
Total 57pday= £229.54 year 
EDF
Electric 23pday= £ 83.48 year 
Gas 25pday= £ 90.78year 
Total 42pday= £174.36year
Source:www.theenergyshop.com
attributes.background: The energy crisis is exacerbated by energy supplier’s insistence on charging daily standing charges whether energy is used or not. This is an unnecessarily imposed tax on the consumer, of up to £208+ a year & rising. Removal of these unfair charges, could at a stroke drastically cut energy bills.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Decisions on whether to include a standing charge, or to include these costs in usage charges are a matter for energy providers.
